title: Systems of Equations - Matrix Operations- Part C

content.description: The function <math> <semantics> <mi>L</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGmbaaaa@39CD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a linear transformation of vectors defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>L</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="true">→</mo> </mover> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@423E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWG2bGbaSaaaaa@3A08@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a column vector and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>4</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40AD@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. It is known that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>L</mi><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>y</mi> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>7</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>19</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4625@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question:
Part C

The function <math> <semantics> <mi>K</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGlbaaaa@39CC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a linear transformation of vectors defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="true">→</mo> </mover> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42CC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWG2bGbaSaaaaa@3A08@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a column vector, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>4</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40AD@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>1</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4190@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find the product matrix <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbGaamOqaaaa@3A89@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and determine the image of vector <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>〈</mo> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>b</mi> </mrow> <mo>〉</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>a</mi> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>b</mi> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43A6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> under the linear transformation <math> <semantics> <mi>K</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGlbaaaa@39CC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
